page.title: 02The Village of Ravensworth
page.content: (Cont.) Some of the houses have original {Yorkshire sash windows.} Building continued in the 18th and 19th cents. and the most recent new buildings were erected in the 1970's. These are of stone and include family houses and bungalows for the elderly and for the design of which the{County {Architect}won a{National award.} Part of the site for the new housing contained a{"Cruck house"}but this was demolished. The timbers from this old house are being restored at the present time and will be on display in the{Richmondshire Museum}in due course.
